property.caption: Height
property.description: Height of the widget (e.g. 300px or 100%).

property.caption: Width
property.description: Width of the widget (e.g. 300px or 100%).

property.caption: Chart implementation
property.description: Chart rendering engine. Either Flot (free) or Highcharts.com (non free). The latter one supports more features but requires a license for non-commercial use. See http://www.highcharts.com/license for more details. So without a proper license one is not free to use the 'highcarts' settings.

property.caption: Chart type
property.description: Check http://api.highcharts.com/highcharts#plotOptions for explanation.

enumerationValues.enumerationValue: Other or combinations (define type in chart series)

property.caption: Chart caption
property.description: Caption of the chart.

property.caption: Name
property.description: The label of this serie

property.caption: Entity
property.description: The object which represents a single point in this serie

property.caption: Constraint
property.description: Constrain the objects to be shown.

property.caption: Category (x)
property.description: The attribute which specifies the categorie or X value of a point in the chart. References are allowed here. Note that all series should use a Category that correlate with eachother. Otherwise the X-axis might contain undesired values.

property.caption: Serie type
property.description: Check http://api.highcharts.com/highcharts#series.type for descriptions on the serie types

property.caption: Dash style
property.description: A name for the dash style to use for the graph. Applies only to series type having a graph, like line, spline, area and scatter in case it has a lineWidth.

property.caption: Step
property.description: Whether to apply steps to the line. Possible values are left, center and right. Prior to 2.3.5, only left was supported. Defaults to false.

property.caption: Add suffix
property.description: Whether to add the suffix (c) of (i) to the tooltip

property.caption: Stack
property.description: This option allows grouping series in a stacked chart. The stack option can be a string or a number or anything else, as long as the grouped series' stack options match each other.

property.caption: Marker radius
property.description: This option allows to set de radius of the marker (in px).

property.caption: Marker symbol
property.description: This option allows to set de symbol of the marker. Possible options are: "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle" and "triangle-down". Another option is to add url(https://www.highcharts.com/samples/graphics/sun.png) with any url you want.

property.caption: Value (y)
property.description: If a reference set is used, the aggregate function will be applied. If not defined, the value '1' will be used. Note that an aggregate function is strongly advised in that case.

property.caption: Use primary Y axis
property.description: If true, this serie uses the primary Y axis. If false, this serie uses the secondary Y axis, which has its own range. For the first serie, this value should always be true.

property.caption: Aggregate function
property.description:
Defines how data is aggregated when multiple Y values are available for a single X value.
Sum: Adds up the Y values and plot it on X.
Count: counts the number of Y values available for a single point. This ignores the Y value, it does not matter if an Y value is selected.
Avg/Max/Min: Takes the average/maximum/minimum of the availble Y values.
Plot individual points: For each Y value a seperate 'column' appears.
First only: Only take the first value available, ignore the others.
Last only: Only take the last value available, ignore the others. Usefull to only display the 'current' state.
Log of the Sum: First sums, that takes the Log of that value.

property.caption: Color
property.description: Specifies a color for this serie. This color should be a valid css color. (for example: 'red', '#ff000' or rgb(255,0,0) are all valid). If empty, a default color will be assigned.

property.caption: Show Line points
property.description: If we have a line chart, indicates if points should be shown within the line for each item.

property.caption: On click
property.description: This microflow will be invoked when a specific point of this serie is clicked. If an aggregation function is used, the onclick is triggered for the first object usedin the aggregation.

property.caption: Extra options
property.description:
This property can be used to add additional options for the serie, this option is implementation specific and has only been tested with Flot. For Flot see: https://github.com/flot/flot/blob/master/API.md
Example: to override the default chart type and show this serie as a line instead of a bar specify: for Flot: "{ lines: { show: true } ,bars: { show: false }, colors: ["#4280CA","#5A4CD0","#36CAA1"] } "

property.caption: Serie Entity
property.description: The object which represents a single point in this serie

property.caption: Serie Attribute
property.description: When using Dynamic Series, which entity or attribute is determining the unique nr of series.

property.caption: Serie Constraint
property.description: When using a Dynamic Serie if you want to limit the nr of series, add the constraint in here, even if it is the same constraint as the datapoints.

property.caption: X axis label
property.description: Label of the X axis.

property.caption: Date aggregation
property.description:
Use this field to determine in which time interval data should be aggregated. Use 'No aggregation' if events on different timestamps (in milliseconds) should be displayed as unique points. Use 'Hour' if all data within the same hour should be aggregated, etc.
The aggregation function of the individual series is applied. Usually 'count' or 'sum' are the most useful options. Note that this options influences datetime based series only.

property.caption: Date formatting tooltip
property.description: The date format which should be used if applicable for tooltip.

property.caption: Date formatting
property.description: The date format which should be used if applicable.

property.caption: Use linear scaling
property.description: If true, the datapoints are scaled along the X Axis according to the x value, so gaps might be produces. If false, all data points are distributed uniformly. That is, the horizontal distance between two points is constant, regardless the x value. Note that this property only applies for date or numeric X values.

property.caption: Y axis label
property.description: Label of the Y axis.

property.caption: Y Axis unit
property.description: The unit of the first Y axis, for example: 'min.' or 'age'

property.caption: Secondary Y axis label
property.description: Label of the secondary Y axis. This axis will be used when the 'use default axis' of a serie is set to false. (Highcharts only)

property.caption: Secondary Y Axis unit
property.description: The unit of the secondary Y axis, for example: 'min.' or 'age'

property.caption: Filter entity
property.description: This should be the same entity as selectied in the 'Chart Series' and is required in order to use filtering. Leave this property empty is filtering should not be enabled.

property.caption: Available filters
property.description: Use this property to define which filters the user can apply.

property.caption: Filter attribute
property.description: The attribute to filter. Note that filters are applied before the data aggregation functions. If a reference is used, only items actually used in the data are selectable.

property.caption: Enable zoom
property.description: Whether the user can zoom in on a subset of the data. Highcharts only.

property.caption: Shared tooltip
property.description: Whether to display the values in a shared tooltip.

property.caption: Swap axes
property.description: Enabling this property will swap the x and y axis of the chart. Highcharts only.

property.caption: Poll for updates
property.description: Refresh time in seconds.

property.caption: Listen to grid
property.description: If true, the series will be updated based on the listen-to-grid selection.

property.caption: Auto refresh
property.description: If true, the chart will be re-rendered when the context object changes.

property.caption: Extra options
property.description:
This property can be used to add additional options styling info (in JSON format) to the chart when constructing. This option is implementation specific. For Flot see: https://github.com/flot/flot/blob/master/API.md For Highcarts see: http://www.highcharts.com/ref/.
Example: to use steps in the graph, and a red border around the legend specify:
Flot: "{legend: { labelBoxBorderColor: 'red' }, series : { lines : { steps : 'true' } } }" Highcharts: "{legend: { borderColor : 'red' }, plotOptions: { line : { step : true } } }"

property.caption: Enable Plotbands
property.description: This will enable the possibility to plot colored plotbands on the y-axis.

property.caption: Plotband entity
property.description: The entity that holds the plotband information

property.caption: Max
property.description: The attribute that specifies the maximum red value

property.caption: High-high
property.description: The attribute that specifies the minimum red value

property.caption: High
property.description: The attribute that specifies the maximum green value

property.caption: Low
property.description: The attribute that specifies the minimum green value

property.caption: Low-low
property.description: The attribute that specifies the maximum red value

property.caption: Min
property.description: The attribute that specifies the minimum red value
